sentences: Meil on üks kaart sellest piirkonnast.
context: The word 'kaardi' is the genitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'kaar' in the context of 'kaar+d'. In this case, it functions as an object marker meaning 'of a card' or 'for a card'. It can refer to either playing cards or maps depending on context. The base form 'kaar' (card/map) becomes 'kaardi' when used with possessive structures or when indicating the direction/movement toward something.
